resources.string: Why choose this program over another?
Skills and tools
The best work internship in six semesters
Curriculum Description
What is unique to the program?
High placement of jobs
blahblahblah
Students love computer science
Preparation for University
What is unique to the program?

The Legacy to Mobile (L2M) program provides a unique experience in developing and supporting computer systems to satisfy business requirements. 
 
Graduates are well trained for a career as a programmer analyst or as technical support. 
 
Students will also benefit from excellent on-site training at companies, which may lead to full-time careers.

The skills and tools ultilized consist of:

Problem solving,
Software design,
Operating systems,
Computer programming,
Client/server - multi-tiered architecture,
Web development,
Object-oriented programming,
Mobile device programming,
Database design and management
and Mainframe application programming.

During the sixth semester, students will be placed into different companies for their externship.\nThe externship is 12 weeks long and allows students to gain experience through appling their knowledge in the workspace.\nAt the end of the externship, students may have the possibility to stay in the same company as a full time employee.

The computer science program offers split out through 6 semesters:

Introduction to object oriented programming,
computer fundamentals,
web interface design,
quantitative methods,
operating systems and scripting,
game development,
database design and sql language,
networking and internet services,
RPG,
COBOL,
mobile development 
and systems anaylsis.

The computer science and math program offers splut out through 4 semesters:

introduction to programming,
Calculus 1 and Calculus 2,
physics,
Object oriented programming,
chemistry,
linear algebra
and descrete mathematics.

Computer science is unique as it allows students to work towards their DEC. Once completeing the program, they have the choice of either going directly to the workforce, or to continue their education in university.\nDuring the 6 semesters of the program, the students learn various programming languages and get actual experience at the end of their 6th semester.

A career as a Computer Programmer Analyst can provide you with exciting and rewarding work in areas such as:

Computer programming,
Web Development,
Systems Development,
Data Modeling,
and Database Administration.

The Computer Science and Mathematics program will allow graduates to pursue studies in the exciting and ever growing field of Computer Sciences.\nAs a pre-university program, students are also able to enter university programs in Mathematics, Actuarial Sciences, Computer Gaming, Information Systems as well as traditional fields of study in both sciences and engineering.
Why choose this program over another?

Students love computer science and math as it allows them to obtain general computer science courses, while also taking the math courses that they need for university. These students love the getting the university prerequisites out of the way so that they have less to do when they start university.

The skills and tools offered consist of:

Interpret and evaluate solutions and theories,
Take a systematic approach to problem solving,
Use information and communications technologies to solve problems in a scientific context,
Conduct research and carry out projects pertaining to situations,
problems or issues by drawing on several fields of knowledge,
Learn to work individually and as part of a team,
Develop personal abilities in analysis and reasoning,
Conduct a comprehensive assessment in the area of computer science and mathematics

The innovative computer science courses in this program will give you the chance to take your skills, interests and passion for computers and technology and turn them into an exciting base for academic studies as you graduate and move on to university.

The innovative computer science courses in this program will give you the chance to take your skills, interests and passion for computers and technology and turn them into an exciting base for academic studies.\nStudents in Computer Science and Mathematics will use a program approach to present scientific solutions to problems using math, chemistry and physics. While studying Computer Sciences and Mathematics you will combine science and computer technology courses.
